title: MaiaSpace to use former Soyuz launch pad in French Guiana
summary: The French space agency CNES has selected MaiaSpace, a startup backed by ArianeGroup developing a reusable small launch vehicle, to take over a launch pad in French Guiana originally built for the Soyuz rocket.

title: Hubble Captures Steller Nurseries in a Majestic Spiral
summary: This image from the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope features the spiral galaxy IC 1954, located 45 million light-years from Earth in the constellation Horologium. It sports a glowing bar in its core, majestically winding spiral arms, and clouds of dark dust across it. Numerous glowing, pink spots across the disc of the galaxy are H-alpha […]

title: NASA funds Starfish Space debris inspection mission
summary: NASA awarded a $15 million contract to Starfish Space to fund development of a debris inspection mission as the agency examines the future of a bigger satellite servicing project.

title: Earth from Space: Northern Territory, Australia
summary: This image captured by the Copernicus Sentinel-1 mission reveals the impact of severe flooding following heavy rain that hit Australia’s Northern Territory in March 2024.

title: D-Orbit raises 150 million euros in two-part Series C round
summary: PARIS — Italian space logistics firm D-Orbit has raised 150 million euros ($168 million) in a two-part Series C funding round. After announcing investments of 100 million euros in January, […]

title: MaiaSpace Tapped to Take Over Soyuz Site in French Guiana
summary: MaiaSpace, a subsidiary of ArianeGroup, has received approval from CNES to repurpose the Soyuz launchpad in French Guiana for its operations. Founded in late 2021, MaiaSpace is developing a two-stage, partially reusable rocket called Maia. The rocket, when being recovered, will be capable of delivering payloads of up to 500 kilograms to low Earth orbit. […]

title: NASA Hosts Two Workshops for Consultation on LEO Microgravity Strategy
summary: As part of NASA’s effort to advance microgravity science, technology, and exploration in low Earth orbit (LEO), the agency conducted two stakeholder workshops in London and Washington to solicit feedback from the international community, including NASA’s international partners, American industry, and academia on Sept. 6 and Sept. 13, respectively. The agency released a draft set […]

title: ISS finishes out eventful third quarter of 2024 with Expedition 71 giving way to Expedition 72
summary: The International Space Station (ISS) has spent the last three months with a larger crew complement than usual following the Starliner Crew Flight Test (CFT) docking with the ISS on June 6. However, the Station’s crew complement is about to return to its normal seven astronauts from nine with the imminent departure of Crew-8 and Crew Dragon Endeavour after the handover with the CFT and two Crew-9 astronauts.

title: FCC releases more radio waves for NGSO broadband
summary: The Federal Communications Commission voted Sept. 26 to open up more spectrum to Starlink and other non-geostationary satellite operators to improve broadband speeds in the United States.

title: Space Force kicks off $1 billion cloud-based satellite operations program
summary: The Space Rapid Capabilities Office in June selected 20 technology companies to participate in the R2C2 program
